SOC2.name: SOC 2 Type II
SOC2.description: Service Organization Control 2 - Trust Service Criteria

CC1.1.title: Demonstrates Commitment to Integrity and Ethical Values
CC1.1.description: The entity demonstrates a commitment to integrity and ethical values.

CC1.2.title: Exercises Oversight Responsibility
CC1.2.description: The board of directors demonstrates independence from management and exercises oversight of the development and performance of internal control.

CC1.3.title: Establishes Structure, Authority, and Responsibility
CC1.3.description: Management establishes, with board oversight, structures, reporting lines, and appropriate authorities and responsibilities.

CC1.4.title: Demonstrates Commitment to Competence
CC1.4.description: The entity demonstrates a commitment to attract, develop, and retain competent individuals.

CC1.5.title: Enforces Accountability
CC1.5.description: The entity holds individuals accountable for their internal control responsibilities.

CC2.1.title: Obtains or Generates and Uses Relevant Information
CC2.1.description: The entity obtains or generates and uses relevant, quality information to support the functioning of internal control.

CC2.2.title: Internal Communication
CC2.2.description: The entity internally communicates information, including objectives and responsibilities for internal control.

CC2.3.title: External Communication
CC2.3.description: The entity communicates with external parties regarding matters affecting the functioning of internal control.

CC3.1.title: Specifies Suitable Objectives
CC3.1.description: The entity specifies objectives with sufficient clarity to enable the identification and assessment of risks relating to objectives.

CC3.2.title: Identifies and Analyzes Risks
CC3.2.description: The entity identifies risks to the achievement of its objectives and analyzes risks as a basis for determining how the risks should be managed.

CC3.3.title: Assesses Fraud Risk
CC3.3.description: The entity considers the potential for fraud in assessing risks to the achievement of objectives.

CC3.4.title: Identifies and Assesses Changes
CC3.4.description: The entity identifies and assesses changes that could significantly impact the system of internal control.

CC4.1.title: Selects, Develops, and Performs Ongoing and/or Separate Evaluations
CC4.1.description: The entity selects, develops, and performs ongoing and/or separate evaluations to ascertain whether the components of internal control are present and functioning.

CC4.2.title: Evaluates and Communicates Deficiencies
CC4.2.description: The entity evaluates and communicates internal control deficiencies in a timely manner to those parties responsible for taking corrective action.

CC5.1.title: Selects and Develops Control Activities
CC5.1.description: The entity selects and develops control activities that contribute to the mitigation of risks to the achievement of objectives to acceptable levels.

CC5.2.title: Selects and Develops General Controls Over Technology
CC5.2.description: The entity also selects and develops general control activities over technology to support the achievement of objectives.

CC5.3.title: Deploys Through Policies and Procedures
CC5.3.description: The entity deploys control activities through policies that establish what is expected and in procedures that put policies into action.

CC6.1.title: Logical Access Controls
CC6.1.description: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets.

CC6.2.title: User Access Provisioning
CC6.2.description: Prior to issuing system credentials and granting system access, the entity registers and authorizes new internal and external users.

CC6.3.title: Data Isolation
CC6.3.description: The entity prevents or detects and acts upon the introduction of unauthorized or malicious software.

CC6.4.title: Physical Access to Facilities
CC6.4.description: The entity restricts physical access to facilities and protected information assets.

CC6.5.title: Disposal of Data and Equipment
CC6.5.description: The entity disposes of data and equipment in accordance with its data retention and disposal policies.

CC6.6.title: Logical Access Management
CC6.6.description: The entity implements logical access security measures to protect against threats from sources outside its system boundaries.

CC6.7.title: Encryption
CC6.7.description: The entity uses encryption and other measures to protect data at rest and in transit.

CC6.8.title: Prevention of Malicious Software
CC6.8.description: The entity implements controls to prevent or detect and act upon the introduction of unauthorized or malicious software.

CC7.1.title: Monitoring System Components
CC7.1.description: To meet its objectives, the entity uses detection and monitoring procedures to identify anomalies.

CC7.2.title: Monitoring System Performance
CC7.2.description: The entity monitors system components and the operation of those components for anomalies.

CC7.3.title: Backup and Recovery
CC7.3.description: The entity evaluates security events to determine whether they could or have resulted in a failure of the entity to meet its objectives.

CC7.4.title: Incident Response
CC7.4.description: The entity responds to identified security incidents by executing a defined incident response program.

CC7.5.title: Processing Integrity
CC7.5.description: The entity identifies, develops, and implements activities to recover from identified security incidents.

CC8.1.title: Change Management Process
CC8.1.description: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, configures, documents, tests, approves, and implements changes to infrastructure, data, software, and procedures.

CC9.1.title: Vendor Risk Management
CC9.1.description: The entity identifies, selects, and develops risk mitigation activities for risks arising from potential business disruptions.

CC9.2.title: Business Continuity
CC9.2.description: The entity assesses and manages risks associated with vendors and business partners.

HIPAA.name: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
HIPAA.description: HIPAA Security Rule for protecting electronic Protected Health Information (ePHI)

164.308(a)(1).title: Security Management Process
164.308(a)(1).description: Implement policies and procedures to prevent, detect, contain, and correct security violations.

164.308(a)(2).title: Assigned Security Responsibility
164.308(a)(2).description: Identify the security official responsible for developing and implementing security policies and procedures.

164.308(a)(3).title: Workforce Security
164.308(a)(3).description: Implement policies and procedures to ensure workforce members have appropriate access to ePHI.

164.308(a)(4).title: Information Access Management
164.308(a)(4).description: Implement policies and procedures for authorizing access to ePHI.

164.308(a)(5).title: Security Awareness and Training
164.308(a)(5).description: Implement security awareness and training program for all workforce members.

164.308(a)(6).title: Security Incident Procedures
164.308(a)(6).description: Implement policies and procedures to address security incidents.

164.308(a)(7).title: Contingency Plan
164.308(a)(7).description: Establish policies and procedures for responding to emergencies that damage ePHI systems.

164.308(a)(8).title: Evaluation
164.308(a)(8).description: Perform periodic technical and nontechnical evaluations of security measures.

164.308(b).title: Business Associate Contracts
164.308(b).description: Obtain satisfactory assurances that business associates will appropriately safeguard ePHI.

164.310(a).title: Facility Access Controls
164.310(a).description: Implement policies and procedures to limit physical access to electronic information systems.

164.310(b).title: Workstation Use
164.310(b).description: Implement policies and procedures that specify proper functions and physical attributes of workstations.

164.310(c).title: Workstation Security
164.310(c).description: Implement physical safeguards for all workstations that access ePHI.

164.310(d).title: Device and Media Controls
164.310(d).description: Implement policies and procedures for receipt and removal of hardware and electronic media containing ePHI.

164.312(a).title: Access Control
164.312(a).description: Implement technical policies and procedures to allow access only to authorized persons.

164.312(b).title: Audit Controls
164.312(b).description: Implement hardware, software, and procedural mechanisms to record and examine access and activity in information systems containing ePHI.

164.312(c).title: Integrity
164.312(c).description: Implement policies and procedures to protect ePHI from improper alteration or destruction.

164.312(d).title: Transmission Security
164.312(d).description: Implement technical security measures to guard against unauthorized access to ePHI transmitted over electronic networks.
